channel.title: Client wont connect to server
channel.description:
Alright so here's the problem, i cannot get my client to connect to my server.
I have tried hosting on [u]no-ip[/u]. Didn't work. I have tried using [u]hamachi[/u]. Didn't work.
I have edited my server and client as needed to properly connect to each other, both locally and remotely. It does work when i connect [u]locally[/u] in my own network using a [b]router[/b] ([i]not hamachi[/i]), but no way will it connect if i use hamachi ip address or a no-ip address. And i think i may have came to a conclusion to my problem.
I have a router with [u]NAT[/u], and assigned both the client & server to use both port 43594. I have setup port forwarding on my Linksys router to forward port 43594 ([i]TCP/UDP[/i]) to 192.168.10.5 ([i]server[/i]). I have read online that only 1 computer can use a given port on a network at a time ([i]e.g 43594[/i]). So if i have my server activated and using port 43594, and try to run a client to connect to the server on a different computer (in the same router network), [b]that will not work[/b]? But if i would try to connect to the server at a different location using the client, [b]it should work[/b]?
